ai.summary: The Lisnaharney Public Right of Way offers an 8 km moderate hike through varied UK countryside. This route follows a public right of way with mixed surfaces, including grassy tracks, gravel paths, and occasional wet sections. Expect gentle elevation changes and a few gates or stiles along the way, making it suitable for walkers with moderate fitness and footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain throughout: packed gravel and compacted dirt paths, short grassy field sections, potential muddy patches after rain, and gates or stiles at field boundaries. Some sections may be narrow; footing should be mindful in wet or damp conditions. Expect light to moderate elevation change with occasional gentle ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: Check local maps and signage for the public right of way. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and layered clothing. Be prepared for sudden UK weather changes, and carry a map or GPS, water, and snacks. Watch for livestock and field gates; close gates behind you. Let someone know your plans and avoid walking alone in remote sections after dark.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots with good grip
Headtorch or flashlight (for extended daylight variability)
Mobile phone charged and offline navigation app
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) when daylight is longer and the weather is milder; note that winter hikes can be muddy and the ground can be slippery, requiring extra caution and appropriate gear.

seo.title: Lisnaharney Public Right of Way – 8 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 8 km Lisnaharney Public Right of Way, a moderate UK hike with varied terrain, practical safety tips, and gear recommendations for a comfortable day on public paths.
